text: They haven't in reality reduced the ballast of belief. Something approaching a conservation law is at work in such matters. I'm not seeing many Pyrrho types among current 'secular' progressives.
Why do you hate eugenics Anon?

When the Islamo-leftist alliance began, Islam was vastly less a western domestic issue than a foreign policy concern. It was mostly during and after losing the 'war on terror' that it became an ethnodemographic calamity (in Western Europe especially).
Hookers are getting wiped out even before computer programmers.
Secular rationalism ends up with you eating a shotgun.
Nietzsche was so secular he conceived nihilism as the providential destiny of Christendom and revocalized a Manichean prophet to announce the coming of the Overman.

... Seriously, though, I'd be thrilled to see long passages of Also Sprach Zarathustra recited in Congress to convince everyone that religion was dead. "We've advanced into the post-belief realms of eternal recurrence now." ...
... No, this is not sarcastic, or even merely meta-sarcastic.
Nihilism is 'secularism' conceived as a religious event.
"You go to women? Do not forget the whip!"
Nietzsche was such a thoroughgoing Puritan he denied himself everything in his religious tradition that could possibly be comforting.
Oh c'mon, think of the comedy.
This is in fact to nitpick.
So he had a teenage Catholic moment.
You too, but your point is really directed more at Nietzsche than me.
BAP is LARPing as one, but I'm confident he'll get over it.
Wasn't he ultimately more concerned with announcing the successor to the human animal?
Indeed, and not remotely religion in general.
He himself treated Zarathutra as scripture and cited it dazed with awe.
Overman speaks English, confirmed.
"Save Christianity" is such a bizarre formulation.
That isn't providence (divine will manifested through history), it's your substitution for providence (an arc of history vindicating your own moral presumptions).
What is "without Religion" doing here, except spreading smoke?
'Will to power' is divine will manifested through history, as Schopenhauer's 'will to life' (explicitly) was. Or perhaps you think you're going to find transcendental-cosmic will under a microscope?
He explicitly identifies it with the Vedanta.
... Nietzsche uses the word 'divine' ('göttlich') often, btw, and only ever in a positive sense.
I have no access to Schopenhauer's oeuvre right now, but the connection is solid enough to have a substantial literature based on it. srichinmoycentre.org/files/M…
Reformed Christianity.
Well put.
Nietzsche's Zarathustra was (a recovered one).
They shipped-out all the human stock with a spine to the colonial frontier?

I've been asking myself "The UK cops can't all be totalitarian human garbage, can they?" 
Apparently not all.
